items.title: Inside the Most Valuable Team in Women’s Sports
items.summary: Expectations were low for the Golden State Valkyries, the W.N.B.A.’s first expansion team in 17 years, but they captivated Bay Area sports fans and surprised the league by securing a playoff spot in their first season.

items.title: In an Era of Deep Polarization, Unity Is Not Trump’s Mission
items.summary: President Trump does not subscribe to the traditional notion of being president for all Americans.

items.title: Trump’s Reversals on Immigration Mount Over Economic Concerns
items.summary: President Trump has walked back some significant immigration policies that collide with his economic agenda, angering his far-right allies.

items.title: How Nancy Pelosi Quietly Shaped California’s Redistricting Fight
items.summary: Private meetings and longtime loyalties helped push what began as a something of a Democratic bluff into a full-fledged counteroffensive against President Trump.

items.title: On the Supreme Court’s Emergency Docket, Sharp Partisan Divides
items.summary: The second Trump administration has filed roughly the same number of applications so far as the Biden administration did over four years. But they have fared quite differently.

items.title: Inside a ‘Hell on Earth’ in Oklahoma
items.summary: The Greer Center was supposed to be a refuge for people with developmental disabilities. But accounts from inside the secretive facility paint a starkly different picture, depicting a place where helpless patients faced beatings, waterboarding and constant fear.

items.title: Rubio arrives in Israel amid tensions over strike on Hamas leaders in Qatar
items.summary: <p>US secretary of state says Trump ‘not happy’ about Israeli attack that targeted Hamas officials in Doha for Gaza talks</p><p>The US secretary of state, Marco Rubio, has arrived in Israel seeking to mend a rift with Washington’s other allies in the region over <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/world/2025/sep/10/israel-threats-outrage-qatar-strike-hamas">Israel’s attempted assassination of Hamas leaders in Qatar</a> and the accelerated expansion of settlements in the occupied West Bank.</p><p>In talks with the Israeli prime minister, Benjamin Netanyahu, Rubio will try to balance criticism of the Israeli airstrike on a Doha building, which killed aides to a Hamas leader and a Qatari security officer, with a message of overall support for Israel before the expected formal recognition of Palestine by a number of other US allies, including the UK, France, Canada, Australia and Belgium.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/world/2025/sep/14/rubio-visit-middle-east-israel-qatar-hamas">Continue reading...</a>

items.title: How the US rightwing is taking over news media and choking press freedom
items.summary: <p>Takeover of broadcast companies by Donald Trump’s allies is harbinger of media capitulation to authoritarian leanings</p><p>The US right has appeared to increase its influence on mainstream media in America in recent weeks, especially in television news which has been a major target of the Donald Trump administration.</p><p>CBS News – once home to legends of US journalism like Walter Cronkite and Edward R Murrow – installed a Trump ally as its ombudsman, weeks after the family of <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/sep/11/who-is-larry-ellison-richest-person-oracle">Larry Ellison</a>, one of the world’s richest men, and a friend of the US president, sealed control over Paramount, the owner of CBS.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/sep/14/rightwing-news-media-journalism">Continue reading...</a>
